page.title: 01Whithorn in Galloway
page.content: Whithorn is a quiet residential village with a high percentage of retired people. Quite a few of the young folks go elsewhere to find employment. Others work in local shops, farms or are unemployed. One of the features of Whithorn is that it is an Ancient and Royal Burgh. Most visitors go to see the "Vaults" where the Monks lived long ago. St. Ninian is supposed to be buried there, also there is a Museum which is interesting In 1984 there was an excavation which uncovered an ancient burial ground. There is Green Bowling and in the winter, evening classes, 'Pool' in the local pubs, a library, Bingo Hall also Annual Flower Show. The surrounding area is all farm land with mostly dairy farming. There is a bus service but not always convenient & one needs a car to get around the countryside.
